Package models

Class FlexiblePortfolioImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.AbstractPortfolio
      • models.FlexiblePortfolioImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FlexiblePortfolio
    public class FlexiblePortfolioImpl
extends AbstractPortfolio
implements FlexiblePortfolio
    This class represents a flexible portfolio. A flexible portfolio supports buying and selling of shares on various dates provided the selling operations are consistent with previous transactions. A flexible portfolio has a hashmap where symbols are the keys and flexible stocks are the values.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class models.AbstractPortfolio

        flexible

    • Method Detail

      • buyStock

        public void buyStock​(java.lang.String symbol,
                     java.time.LocalDate date,
                     float numberOfShares,
                     float transactionCost)
        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
        This method is used to buy a stock and add it to this user's active portfolio. A flexible portfolio contains a hashmap which stores all these stocks. To add a stock to the portfolio user needs to enter Stock Symbol, number of shares he wants, date on which he wants and the transaction cost associated with it.
        Specified by:
        buyStock in interface FlexiblePortfolio
        Overrides:
        buyStock in class AbstractPortfolio
        Parameters:
        symbol - String which should be a valid.
        date - LocalDate date on which he wants to purchase.
        numberOfShares - float which is the number of shares the user wants of that company.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.

      • sellStock

        public void sellStock​(java.lang.String symbol,
                      java.time.LocalDate date,
                      float numberOfShares,
                      float transactionCost)
        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
        This method is used to sell a stock from user's active portfolio. It checks if it possible to sell the stocks and sells them only if it is possible. To sell a stock from a portfolio user needs to enter Stock Symbol, number of shares he wants, date on which he wants to sell and the transaction cost associated with it.
        Specified by:
        sellStock in interface FlexiblePortfolio
        Overrides:
        sellStock in class AbstractPortfolio
        Parameters:
        symbol - String which should be a valid.
        date - LocalDate date on which he wants to sell.
        numberOfShares - float which is the number of shares the user wants to sell.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.

                           ApiType apiType)
        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
        This method is used to get the total value of this user's active portfolio on a certain date. If weekend values are given then it tells the user to enter a date which is not weekend.

        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio

      • investIntoPortfolio

        public void investIntoPortfolio​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                float amount,
                                float transactionCost,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Float> stocks,
                                ApiType apiType)
        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
        This method is used to invest a specific amount in an existing flexible portfolio on a specific date by specifying the weights of how that money should be invested in each stock inside that portfolio.
        Specified by:
        investIntoPortfolio in interface FlexiblePortfolio
        Overrides:
        investIntoPortfolio in class AbstractPortfolio
        Parameters:
        date - LocalDate date on which he wants to purchase.
        amount - float amount which the user wants to invest.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.
        stocks - Hashmap of stocks which contains the Symbol as key and weight as value.
        apiType - ApiType used determine which third party api is to be called.

      • createDollarCostStrategyPortfolio

        public void createDollarCostStrategyPortfolio​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                              java.time.LocalDate endDate,

                                              float amount,
                                              float transactionCost,
                                              java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Float> stocks)
        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
        This method is used to create a portfolio using dollar-cost averaging as specified above, and query cost basis and value of such a portfolio at a specific date.
        Specified by:
        createDollarCostStrategyPortfolio in interface FlexiblePortfolio
        Overrides:
        createDollarCostStrategyPortfolio in class AbstractPortfolio
        Parameters:
        startDate - LocalDate date on which he wants to start the purchase.
        endDate - LocalDate date on which he wants to end the purchase.
        interval - float interval in which the user wants to invest.
        amount - float amount which the user wants to invest.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.
        stocks - Hashmap of stocks which contains the Symbol as key and weight as value.

        Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolio
